resources.string: Welcome to the PC Self Builder! Would you like to get started?
Hello! It seems that you\'ve already made a PC with our app. Would you like to see your build again?
What is your budget for this computer?
Which of the following will you use your computer for often?
Which of these will be your primary use?
How much storage will you need?
Here are your recommended PC Parts! Tap on a part to find out where to purchase it.
Unfortunately, a computer with your specifications could not be built. An option close to your budget is displayed.
The PSU, or Power Supply Unit, powers the computer
1. Insert the PSU into the mounting area and screw it in.\n\n2. Ensure the unit is switched off and then plug it in.
The CPU, or Central Processing Unit, acts as the brain of the computer.
1. Open the CPU latch on the motherboard and insert the CPU.\n\n2. Close the CPU latch on the motherboard.
The RAM, or Random Access Memory, is the cache for the computer; in other words, it\'s the computer\'s short term memory.

1. Unlock the RAM locks on the motherboard

2. Insert the RAM module.

3. Push down on the stick until it clicks into place.
The Motherboard connects each component of the computer together.

1. Click the I/O shield into place in the rear cutout.

2. Install the standoffs for the motherboard and lower the board onto them.

3. Tighten the screws.
The storage allows data to persist on your computer after you shut it off.

1. Locate the storage bracket on your case.

2. Screw the storage device into the bracket.

3. Secure the bracket to the case
Time to connect all of the pieces!

1. Plug the PSU cables into the motherboard.

2. Connect the storage drive to the PSU.

3. Connect the storage drive to the motherboard.
The GPU, or Graphics Processing Unit, is dedicated to graphics. It is a necessity for gaming and many other activities.

1. Open the motherboard's GPU card latch.

2. Remove the PCIe strip cap from the GPU.

3. Insert the GPU into the motherboard.
Turn on your PSU and your computer, and you\'re free to use your new custom PC!
Are you sure you want to discard your build and start over?
